definition: to revisit old haunts (idiom); down memory lane
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct

sentences.english: Revisiting an old haunt is surely exciting.
sentences.chinese: 故地重遊嘛，當然興奮了。

sentences.english: There are plenty of coins in this lake. Everybody wants to come back again.
sentences.chinese: 這個湖裏有很多的錢幣，每個人都想故地重遊。

sentences.english: When it photographed the same field yesterday, a refugee camp had already sprung up on the grass.
sentences.chinese: 昨天當它故地重遊時，草地已經變成了一個難民營。

sentences.english: The one, who will visit this spa once, shall be back here again.
sentences.chinese: 一旦來此溫泉度假，必定會故地重遊。

sentences.english: No time to re-visit these sites and replenish our spirits.
sentences.chinese: 沒有時間故地重遊，去充實我們的精神世界。

sentences.english: Years after the fall of the Berlin Wall, he returned to the same sites, camera in hand.
sentences.chinese: 後來柏林牆倒塌，數年後，他帶着相機故地重遊。
